page.title: 17LOCAL NEWSPAPER
page.content: 1 The "Berkeley and Sharpness Gazette" is a typical local newspaper serving a wide area stretching from Cambridge in the North to Thornbury in the South. It is published weekly and can, to all intents and purposes be divided into two sections. The first part of each issue deals with all the items of local news such as local Council meetings, societies, farming news and local people as well as any National stories which have a particular bearing on area served by the newspaper. The rest of the newspaper is devoted to Classified and Business advertisements and numerous other private advertisements. As with its sister publication, "The Stroud News and Journal", this second section performs an extremely popular and very successful local service.
